title: Adding Additional Passwords
text: Adding Additional Passwords 26 September 2022 14:14 Guide to adding an additional password to Teamviewer. In the case of below, I was adding an additional password for the customers IT team at their request. Some teamviewer setups are slightly different, but in general the process is the same. When you teamviewer on to their machine you will see the program box as shown below, you will need to go into settings which is accessed by the cog symbol shown to the right of “allow remote control” Sometimes tv will be set up so you need the password to access settings, as shown below. When this is done you will bring up the settings menu, the option for adding the password is usually in security. When in the security menu you will find the option to “manage additional passwords” highlighted in blue. When this is selected, you will be presented with the pop-up shown below When selected, you then have the option to add the additional password as shown below. When done, select add to complete the process. You will then see the identifier for the new additional password displayed the menu box. The new password has now been set up
description:
Adding Additional Passwords

26 September 2022

14:14

 

Guide to adding an additional password to Teamviewer.

 In the case of below, I was adding an additional password for the customers IT team at their request.

Some teamviewer setups are slightly different, but in general the process is the same. 

When you teamviewer on to their machine you will see the program box as shown below, you will need to go into settings which is accessed by the cog symbol shown to the right of “allow remote control” 

 

Sometimes tv will be set up so you need the password to access settings, as shown below.

 

When this is done you will bring up the settings menu, the option for adding the password is usually in security.

 

 

When in the security menu you will find the option to “manage additional passwords” highlighted in blue.

 

When this is selected, you will be presented with the pop-up shown below

 

 

When selected, you then have the option to add the additional password as shown below. When done, select add to complete the process.

 

 

 

 You will then see the identifier for the new additional password displayed the menu box. The new password has now been set up

title: How to set a DdD password in TeamViewer
text: 1. First get the id and password from the customer. 2. Once logged in, open the TeamViewer window. 3. Click the gear icon 4. Click Security 5. Click Change or Remove this Password 6. Click Manage additional Passwords 7. Set Access Control to Full Access 8. Click Add 9. Fill in Identifier as DdDSupport 10. Give it DdD+2012 as password 11. Repeat 12. Click Add 13. Click Close 14. Click OK 15. Now add the password you just created to our login for the customer 16. Right-click on the customer name and click Properties 18. Add the password, click ok to save and test if it works by closing the connection to the customer and logging in again. If the password is not accepted, the previous password you got from the customer could still be good. Log back in with that and try a different approach. 1. Repeat steps 1. And 2. From above 2. Click on Advanced 3. Click Show advanced options 4. Set the password 5. Click OK Sign out and try logging in again just by double-clicking the customer name.
description:
1. First get the id and password from the customer.

2. Once logged in, open the TeamViewer window.

 


3. Click the gear icon



 

4. Click Security



5. Click Change or Remove this Password



6. Click Manage additional Passwords



7. Set Access Control to Full Access


 8. Click Add


9. Fill in Identifier as DdDSupport

10. Give it DdD+2012 as password

11. Repeat

12. Click Add



13. Click Close



14. Click OK



 15. Now add the password you just created to our login for the customer

16. Right-click on the customer name and click Properties


18. Add the password, click ok to save and test if it works by closing the connection to the customer and logging in again.


If the password is not accepted, the previous password you got from the customer could still be good. Log back in with that and try a different approach.

1. Repeat steps 1. And 2. From above


2. Click on Advanced



3. Click Show advanced options




4. Set the password


5. Click OK


Sign out and try logging in again just by double-clicking the customer name.

title: Musicsound from the customers computer (turn off)
text: Music/sound from the customers computer (turn off) 27 May 2022 15:44 If you log into a customer's computer and hear music (many shops run e.g. Spotify from their POS PCs) you can switch the sound off at your end by clicking on Communicate and removing the tick in Computer sound:
description:
Music/sound from the customers computer (turn off)

27 May 2022

15:44

 

If you log into a customer's computer and hear music (many shops run e.g. Spotify from their POS PCs) you can switch the sound off at your end by clicking on Communicate and removing the tick in Computer sound:

title: Password - missing
text: Password - missing 27 May 2022 15:45 If the customer cannot give you a password for TeamViewer (it shows the ID, but no password), ask them to click on the little gear in the upper right hand corner Choose Security Under Random Password (for spontaneous access), have them check what it says there. If it says Disabled, have them change it to 8 characters, then click ok. This should create a password they can then give you.
description:
Password - missing

27 May 2022

15:45

 

If the customer cannot give you a password for TeamViewer (it shows the ID, but no password), ask them to click on the little gear in the upper right hand corner

 

 

Choose Security 

 

 

 

Under Random Password (for spontaneous access), have them check what it says there. If it says Disabled, have them change it to 8 characters, then click ok.

 

This should create a password they can then give you.

title: Teamviewer blacklisted
text: Teamviewer blacklisted 11 January 2023 10:21 Open teamviewer and go to Options Go to Security Tab Click on Configure below Blocked and Allow list Select "Allow access only to the following partners" Click on "Add" Now select "Add contact manually to your white list" Type in the name that you want to be whitelisted and click "Add" then "Ok" You're all set and done now you can login to the PC.
description:
Teamviewer blacklisted

11 January 2023

10:21

 

  • Open teamviewer and go to Options
      

 

  • Go to Security Tab
  • Click on Configure below Blocked and Allow list

 

 

  • Select "Allow access only to the following partners"
  • Click on "Add"
      

 

 

  • Now select "Add contact manually to your white list"
  • Type in the name that you want to be whitelisted and click "Add" then "Ok"
     
      

 

You're all set and done now you can login to the PC.

title: Teamviewer - replacing Quicksupport with full version
text: Some customers only use Quick Support and may want a proper TeamViewer connection with a saved password, that gives us access without having to rely on the customer being able to find the id og password for us every time. Attention!!! You CANNOT install TeamViewer Full version while being online with TeamViewer Quicksupport on the customer's computer. In this case. the customer will have to give you the TeamViewer ID and password from TeamViewer Quick Support. 1. Log onto the customer's PC with TeamViewer. 2. Download Anydesk from anydesk.com to the customer's computer and your own and open both. 3. Invite yourself to the customers computer. 4. Add the Address number from your Anydesk and click Invite 5. This window will pop up on your pc. Click connect. 6. Anydesk on your pc will open a new window that shows you the customer's pc. 7. Shutdown TeamViewer on the customer's pc. 8. Open teamviewer.com on the customer's PC, download the free full version of Teamviewer and install it. 9. Install TeamViewer. 10 . Open TeamViewer and choose the Gear Icon 11. Choose Advanced and click Show advanced options if they are not showing already 12. Set Access Control to Full Access, add the password to both fields and click ok. Attention!!! If TeamViewer Full Version is already installed and the customer's IT Support has already added a password (2) & (3), the window will look like this: DO NOT DELETE THE PASSWORD ALREADY SET UP!!!! 13. Set Access Control to Full Access (if it's not already), then click Manage additional Passwords. 1. Click Add 2. Set Identifier as DdD Support 3. Add Password 4. Confirm Password 5. Click Add 14. Test if you have access through TeamViewer and that you have the right to click on and edit things. 15. Save the ID and password in our TeamViewer setup. 16. Shut down Anydesk on the customer's PC. It will ask if you want to install it. Click No. Delete the downloaded file.
description:
Some customers only use Quick Support and may want a proper TeamViewer connection with a saved password, that gives us access without having to rely on the customer being able to find the id og password for us every time. 


Attention!!! You CANNOT install TeamViewer Full version while being online with TeamViewer Quicksupport on the customer's computer.


In this case. the customer will have to give you the TeamViewer ID and password from TeamViewer Quick Support. 


1. Log onto the customer's PC with TeamViewer.


2. Download Anydesk from anydesk.com to the customer's computer and your own and open both.



3. Invite yourself to the customers computer.



4. Add the Address number from your Anydesk and click Invite



5. This window will pop up on your pc. Click connect.



6. Anydesk on your pc will open a new window that shows you the customer's pc.


7. Shutdown TeamViewer on the customer's pc.


8. Open teamviewer.com on the customer's PC, download the free full version of Teamviewer and install it.




9. Install TeamViewer.


10 . Open TeamViewer and choose the Gear Icon 



11. Choose Advanced and click Show advanced options if they are not showing already



12. Set Access Control to Full Access, add the password to both fields and click ok.


Attention!!! If TeamViewer Full Version is already installed and the customer's IT Support has already added a password (2) & (3), the window will look like this:


 

DO NOT DELETE THE PASSWORD ALREADY SET UP!!!!


13. Set Access Control to Full Access (if it's not already), then click Manage additional Passwords.



1. Click Add


2. Set Identifier as DdD Support


3. Add Password


4. Confirm Password


5. Click Add


14. Test if you have access through TeamViewer and that you have the right to click on and edit things.


15. Save the ID and password in our TeamViewer setup.




16. Shut down Anydesk on the customer's PC. It will ask if you want to install it. Click No. Delete the downloaded file.

title: Turn off sound / music on Remote PC permanently for all
text: If you are bothered by music / sound from the remote PC and want to turn it off permanently, open TeamViewer Options -> Remote control -> and remove the tick in Play computer sounds and music -> OK
description: If you are bothered by music / sound from the remote PC and want to turn it off permanently, open TeamViewer Options -> Remote control -> and remove the tick in Play computer sounds and music -> OK
